attributes.action: Enforce section 145 of the Highway Code
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
“Do not hold up a long queue of traffic, especially if you are driving a large or slow moving vehicle. Check your mirrors frequently, and if necessary, pull in where it is safe and let traffic pass.”

Better still; restrict movement of slow vehicles such as agricultural, heavy plant (JCB), horse drawn etc… (excl. emergency/recovery) from A and B roads during busy rush hours.

Is there a need for farmers to tow hay, or muck spreaders, at 20 down major commuter routes shortly before 9am? Does that JCB have to be travelling 20mph on a busy, national speed limit, A-road with a huge queue behind it? Why is that HGV doing 30 in a 50?

Travelling behind slow moving vehicles is aggravating, causes impatience and “road rage”. How many times have you seen an impatient driver take unnecessary risks overtaking a slow vehicle?

I realise that this causes logistical problems, but I believe that by restricting slow vehicles from A and B roads during peak hours we can reduce accidents, improve traffic flow and reduce congestion into the cities.
